section.title: Expectations
section.p: This term we are still managing courses remotely beause of the covid-19 pandemic. The physical buildings at PCC are closed, and we cannot conduct in-person instruction.

We all have extra responsibilities this term. As the instructor, I need to use new ways to deliver the course to you at home. I need to be creative and flexible with how we use technology. And you, the student, need to have self-discipline and complete everything that I ask of you. And also to be brave and bring all of your concerns and questions to me as soon as you can.

We can boil down your responsibilities to the following list.
Attend the live sessions we will have in Zoom every Tuesday and Thursday at 9:00.
If you have to miss all or part of a class session, find time to watch the recording.
For class Tuesdays, there is usually some small (and hopefully fun/interesting) thing that I ask you to do before coming to class. Please do these.
Collaborate with your classmates when it is appropriate during our live sessions. When needed, continue to collaborate with your classmates outside of class.
Complete homework (both written and ) by its due date. Work on it early so you have lead time to seek help when needed.
Read sections of the textbook ahead of class.
Use all the tools available to you to communicate with me about your concerns and your questions.
Direct Email
D2L Discussion Posts (can be posted anonymously)
Raising issues during the Zoom sessions
Schedule one-on-one Zoom meeting with me
